alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 22 at 5:06PM EDT until May 22 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Liberty County in Big Bend Florida... East Central Calhoun County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 600 PM CDT /700 PM EDT/. * At 406 PM CDT /506 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 Hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blountstown, Nettle Ridge and Durham. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
